author: TomiKilgore
content:
MGM Resorts International 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    MGM, -0.86%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         said Tuesday it has entered into a multi-year partnership to become the official gaming platform for the National Basketball Association and the Women's National Basketball Association. MGM shares rallied 2.4% in afternoon trade. The partnership, the NBA's first with a sports betting operator, comes after a Supreme Court ruling earlier this year that cleared the way for states to legalize sports betting. As part of the partnership, MGM will use official NBA and WNBA data and branding across its land-based and digital sports bettering offerings. "As the landscape for sports betting in the U.S. continues to evolve at a rapid pace, MGM Resorts is a proven gaming leader for us to work with on this groundbreaking partnership," said NBA Commissioner Adam Silver. ""Our collaboration will result in the best possible gaming and entertainment experience for consumers through the use of accurate, real-time NBA and WNBA data, and our collective efforts to maintain and enhance the integrity of our games." MGM shares have edged up 0.3% over the past three months, while the S&P 500

title: MGM Resorts to partner with NBA and WNBA on sports betting

content:
Facebook Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    FB, -1.55%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         said Tuesday that it has removed 17 Facebook accounts and seven Instagram accounts it says are inauthentic and tied to a coordinated campaign to influence political activity ahead of the midterm elections. According to a blog post by Facebook head of cybersecurity policy Nathaniel Gleicher, more than 290,000 accounts followed one of the inauthentic Facebook pages tied to the fake accounts; the now-removed accounts also spent roughly $11,000 in Canadian and U.S. dollars on Facebook and Instagram. The ads ran from April 2017 until June of this year. The fake pages created about 30 events from May 2017 until now, the largest of which had 1,400 users interested in attending, the blog post said. Facebook said it wasn't able to definitively say who was responsible for the fake accounts and activity, but said that there were some similarities to the Russian-backed accounts the company has disabled in the past. Facebook stock is up 1.2% to $173.21 in early afternoon trading. Facebook stock has lost about 20% since it reported second-quarter earnings last Wednesday that included a weaker-than-expected outlook for the second half of the year. The S&P 500 index has gained 0.1% since Facebook reported earnings.
title: Facebook removes fake accounts related to political influence campaign

author: TonyaGarcia
content:
Denny's Corp. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    DENN, -1.60%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         shares fell 6.6% in Tuesday trading following the after-hours announcement of a second-quarter revenue miss. Net income totaled $11.6 million, or 18 cents per share, up from $8.7 million, or 12 cents per share, last year. Adjusted EPS was 18 cents. Revenue totaled $157.3 million, up from $133.4 million. The FactSet consensus was for EPS of 17 cents and revenue of $161.0 million. Domestic system-wide same-restaurant sales fell 0.7%, with a 0.1% decline at company-owned restaurants and 0.8% decline at domestic franchised restaurants. Denny's expects full-year same-store sales growth between breakeven and 2% growth, and total operating revenue between $626 million and $634 million. The FactSet guidance is for same-store sales growth of 1.3% and revenue of $632.2 million Denny's shares have gained 9.4% for 2018 so far while the S&P 500 index 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, -0.71%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         is up 5.6% for the period.
title: Denny's shares slide after revenue miss

author: TomiKilgore
content:
Shares of Illumina Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    ILMN, -0.97%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         ran up 10.2% toward a record high, after the DNA sequencing company's better-than-expected second-quarter results prompted a host of analysts to raise their price targets. Of the 21 analysts surveyed by FactSet, 12 boosted their stock price targets, lifting the average target to $321.53, which is just 0.8% above current levels, compared with $275.59 as of the end of June. Analyst Tycho Peterson at J.P. Morgan raised his target to $350 from $275, which ties him with at least two other analysts for the highest price target, and reiterated his overweight rating. "2Q18 recap: Boom...Another impressive quarter on the books," Peterson wrote in a note to clients. Leading up to the earnings release, the stock had slumped 8.4% amid a three-session losing streak. It has soared 46% year to date, while the S&P 500 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, -0.71%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         has gained 5.6%.
title: Illumina's stock runs up toward record high as earnings beat prompts price target boosts

author: RobertSchroeder
content: White House chief of staff John Kelly has told staff that President Donald Trump has asked him to stay in his position through the 2020 election, The Wall Street Journal reported Tuesday. Kelly told staff he agreed to Trump's request, the Journal said, citing a White House official. Kelly had been expected to leave sometime this summer.
title: White House Chief of Staff Kelly says he will stay through 2020: WSJ

author: SarahToy
content:
CBS Corporation was downgraded to market perform from outperform on Tuesday by Cowen, which also lowered its price target to $50 from $69. "While we continue to like the company's assets and strategic positioning, between the legal/control fight with National Amusements, the potential for a recombination with Viacom

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    VIAB, +0.00%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         and the allegations of sexual harassment at the company, there are too many unquantifiable variables for us to remain Outperform-rated," analysts wrote, led by Doug Creutz. National Amusements holds almost 80% voting stakes in CBS and Viacom, and its president, Shari Redstone, has been working to merge them despite resistance from CBS

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    CBS, -1.96%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         CEO Leslie Moonves. Creutz called the current investigation of alleged sexual harassment by Moonves an "added overhanging" with uncertain outcomes. "We also worry about the impact on company operations," Creutz added. "At some level, this has to be a distraction -- at a time when the industry is undergoing tremendous change and even companies with no internal turmoil are struggling." CBS shares have fallen 12.4% so far this year, while the S&P 500

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, -0.71%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         has gained 5.5%.
title: CBS downgraded to market perform by Cowen

author: TonyaGarcia
content:
Texas Roadhouse Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    TXRH, -1.08%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         shares are down 4.5% in Tuesday trading following an after-hours earnings miss. Still, the casual dining chain was upgraded to outperform from sector perform at RBC Capital Markets. RBC raised its price target to $68 from $66. "[F]or Texas Roadhouse, the particularly long beef cycle could be ongoing fuel for reinvestment or-eventually-increasing restaurant margins," analysts led by David Palmer wrote. And the "beef cycle" could offset labor costs. Analysts aren't concerned about a deceleration in same-store sales, with Texas Roadhouse reporting 5.7% growth at company restaurants and 3.9% growth at domestic franchise restaurants. "Using these multi-year stacked same-store sales trends implies 3%-to-4% same-store sales growth over the next year, which should drive normalized 10%-plus revenue growth," the note said. Texas Roadhouse shares are up nearly 20% for the year to date while the S&P 500 index 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, -0.71%

title: Texas Roadhouse shares slump after earnings miss, stock upgraded

author: TonyaGarcia
content:
Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    CMG, -0.45%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         shares sank nearly 8% in Tuesday trading after complaints in Ohio of food-related illness. One location was closed briefly after the report. "Reports in the media that an Ohio restaurant was closed after a customer became sick should highlight again that simply changing the CEO does not make problems go away," said John Zolidis, president of Quo Vadis Capital in a note. "In particular, we noted traffic declines in the first half of the year despite several years having past from the first food safety incident. We also don't see much Mr. Niccol can do about rising labor costs or the increase in similar, high-quality fast-causal competition that has developed over the last several years." Chipotle was upgraded on Tuesday based on its growing digital capabilities. Chipotle shares have rallied 48.7% for the year to date, outpacing the S&P 500 index

                                         which is up 5.2% for the period.
title: Chipotle shares sink after reports of food-related illness

"UPS believes in the future of commercial electric vehicles," said Carlton Rose, UPS's president of global fleet maintenance and engineering. UPS's stock surged 1.9% as part of a broad rally in the transportation sector, while Tesla shares gained 0.7%. author: SarahToy
content:
Movie subscription program AMC Stubs A-List has enrolled more than 175,000 members since its launch five weeks ago, AMC Theatres announced Tuesday. AMC Theatres is a subsidiary of AMC Entertainment Holdings, Inc.

                                         The company said it initially expected A-List, which charges a monthly fee of $19.95 to watch three movies a week, to hit 500,000 A-List members one year from the launch. "The growth of AMC Stubs A-List has far exceeded our projections," AMC CEO and president Adam Aron said, adding that the subscription service was designed "to be a profitable program with a price point that is loaded with consumer value while also being sustainable for us and for our guests." author: TomiKilgore
content:
Shares of Advanced Micro Devices Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    AMD, -0.21%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         slumped 3.4% in active morning trade Tuesday, to pull back from an 11 1/2-year high, after the chip maker's second-largest shareholder disclosed a large sale of its holdings. Volume was above 28.9 million shares, making AMD's stock the most actively trade on the Nasdaq exchange. In a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission, Mubadala Investment Co. PJSC disclosed the sale of 22 million AMD shares valued at $427.24 million, which implies a price of $19.42. On Monday, AMD's stock traded in an intraday range of $19.31 to $20.18 before closing at $19.42, which was the highest close since Jan. 11, 2007. Mubadala had owned 56.9 million shares before the stake sale, according to FactSet. The stock has run up 83% year to date, while the PHLX Semiconductor Index

                                         announced it would be raising its monthly subscription fee to $14.95 from $9.95 in the next 30 days as part of a cost-reduction plan. The company said it would also limit the availability of first-run movies during the first two weeks of release on over 1,000 screens. MoviePass has experienced service issues in the past few days, most notably over the weekend when users complained of being unable to watch "Mission: Impossible -- Fallout." Shares of Helios and Matheson rose 127% after the news broke, but shares have fallen 100% so far this year. author: SteveGoldstein
content: Chicago PMI rose 1.4 points to 65.5 in July, the highest reading in six months, MNI Indicators said. Any reading above 50 indicates improving conditions. The new-orders and production indexes also hit six-month highs, while the prices paid index reached a 10-year high, with MNI saying there's anecdotal evidence of tariffs impacting operations.
title: Chicago PMI rises to six-month high in July

author: TonyaGarcia
content:

                                         was upgraded to buy from hold at Jefferies on the restaurant chain's enhancements to handle digital and off-premise business. Jefferies raised its price target to $550 from $400. Analysts led by Andy Barish say they "have improved line of sight to mid-single digit same-store sales in '19/'20" highlighting things like delivery, marketing and operations. "With more predictable pricing and traffic-driven growth, we believe that restaurant-level margins can begin to expand back toward 20%+ levels," analysts wrote. Chipotle shares are down 3.7% in Tuesday trading after media reports of a store closure following food-related illness complaints in Ohio. Shares are up more than 55% for the year so far, outpacing the S&P 500 index

author: MarkDeCambre
content:
The Nasdaq Composite Index on Tuesday opened firmly higher Tuesday, as the technology-laden benchmark attempted to shake off three straight sessions of sharp losses sparked by disappointing quarterly updates from some of the most popular tech and internet-related companies. The Nasdaq 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    COMP, -0.67%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         was up 0.7% at 7,683, the S&P 500 index 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, -0.71%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         rose 0.4% at 2,813, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    DJIA, -0.77%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         climbed 90 points, or 0.4%, at 25,398. Tuesday's early trading action comes after the Nasdaq put in its third straight drop, underpinned by weaker-than-expected outlooks and results from Netflix Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    NFLX, -1.00%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         and Facebook Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    FB, -1.55%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         with shares of both companies falling into bear-market territory, defined as a drop of at least 20% from a recent peak. That unraveling has rattled confidence in the so-called FAANG stocks, which includes Facebook, Amazon.com Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    AMZN, -0.64%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         Apple Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    AAPL, -0.30%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         Netflix and Google-parent Alphabet Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    GOOG, -0.92%
GOOGL, -0.95%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         which have helped to drive the overall market higher. Apple is slated to report its quarterly results after the end of regular trade Tuesday and investors are hoping that the Cupertino, Calif.-based iPhone maker will be able to drive the tech and internet-sector from out of its recent doldrums. Wall Street also will watch the start of the Federal Reserve's two-day policy meeting, which kicks of later in the session. Investors also bought government bonds, as the Bank of Japan announced it would keep its ultra-easy monetary policy in place.
title: Stocks pop at the open, and the Nasdaq tries to bounce off the mat after a 3-session drubbing

author: TomiKilgore
content:
Shares of Castlight Health Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    CSLT, -3.23%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         plummeted 24% to pace all premarket decliners Tuesday, after the healthcare information technology company announced a restructuring program that is in part a result to the unexpected loss of a large customer. The company said it plans to cut costs by 10% to 15% by the end of September, which charges expected to be recorded in the third quarter of 2018. Separately, the company reported a second-quarter net loss that widened to $14.0 million, or 10 cents a share, from $12.4 million, or 9 cents a share, in the same period a year ago. Excluding non-recurring items, the adjusted loss of 5 cents a share matched the FactSet consensus. Revenue rose to $37.8 million from $32.6 million, topping the FactSet consensus of $36.8 million, as 14.5% subscription revenue growth to $34.8 million beat expectations of $33.5 million. The stock had rallied 19% year to date through Monday, while the S&P 500 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, -0.71%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         had gained 4.8%.
title: Castlight Health's stock plummets after unexpected loss of large customer prompts restructuring

Under terms of the deal, Brookfield will pay $25.35 in cash for each Forest City share outstanding, a 10% premium to Monday's stock closing price of $23.02. With about 267.2 million shares outstanding, the deal implies a market capitalization of $6.77 billion for Forest City. The deal is expected to close in the fourth quarter of 2018. Forest City does not expect to pay its quarterly dividend while the deal is pending. Forest City shares had soared 14% on June 18 when speculation of a deal made the rounds.                                          has gained 4.8%.
title: Forest City Realty's stock rallies after deal to be acquired by Brookfield valued at $11.4 billion

author: EmilyBary
content:
Shares of Twitter Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    TWTR, +0.16%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         are up 1.2% in premarket trading Tuesday after Instinet analyst Mark Kelley upgraded the stock to neutral from reduce. He has a $31 price target on the stock. He argued that the stock's risk-reward profile is more balanced following a sharp drop since the company's Friday earnings report. "We believe the investments aimed at cleaning up the greater platform will prove to be a positive in the long run as it likely leads to a more engaged user base," Kelley wrote. "We also expect improving ad formats and more relevant advertisements will lead to advertiser retention and possibly growth over time, and we would view the launch of a self-serve offering as a positive with incremental demand that would likely be accretive to margins." On the negative side, however, he wrote that monthly-active-user trends are difficult to forecast and he expects that the privacy discussion could have a more lasting impact on the company's margins. Shares are up 31% so far in 2018, while the S&P 500 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, -0.71%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         has gained 4.8%.
title: Twitter stock gains after Instinet ends bearish call

Last week, Naked Brand offered an update on lingerie company Frederick's of Hollywood, an acquisition target. content:

                                         shares rose 1.6% in Tuesday premarket trading after the clothing company reported fiscal first-quarter earnings and revenue that beat expectations. Net income totaled $109.0 million, or $1.31 per share, up from $59.5 million, or 72 cents per share, for the same period last year. Adjusted EPS was $1.54. Revenue totaled $1.39 billion, up from $1.35 billion year-over-year. The FactSet consensus was for EPS of $1.36 and revenue of $1.36 billion. North American revenue fell 2%, with wholesale revenue falling due to a deliberate pullback in distribution, while revenue in Europe and Asia increased. Ralph Lauren shares have rallied 31.1% for the year so far, outpacing the S&P 500 index

author: CiaraLinnane
content:
Kraft Heinz 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    khz

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         said Tuesday it is moving to make all of its packaging recyclable, reusable or compostable by 2025. "Our collective industry has a massive challenge ahead of us with respect to packaging recyclability, end-of-life recovery and single-use plastics," Chief Executive Bernardo Hees said in a statement. Kraft Heinz is already working with Environmental Packaging International for consulting, tracking and other specialist services in packaging and will pursue technical alternatives to meet its goals. The company is also aiming to decrease the overall volume of packaging it uses. the company has joined the Science Based Targets Initiative, which works to reduce greenhouse gas emissions in the supply chain. "We found that most of our emissions are coming from areas outside our direct operations," said Hees. "To truly succeed as champions of sustainability, we will look at our full value chain and determine where we can make the greatest impact for our planet." Shares have fallen 22.5% in 2018, while the S&P 500 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, -0.71%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         has gained 4.8%.
title: Kraft Heinz to make all packaging recyclable, reusable or compostable by 2025

author: TomiKilgore
content:
Shares of Arconic Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    ARNC, +0.19%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         jumped 4.1% in premarket trade Tuesday after the company reported second-quarter earnings and revenue that beat expectations. Net income fell to $120 million, or 24 cents a share, from $212 million, or 43 cents a share, in the same period a year ago. Excluding non-recurring items, adjusted earnings per share came to 37 cents, above the FactSet consensus of 29 cents. Revenue increased 10% to $3.57 billion, beating the FactSet consensus of $3.49 billion. The manufacturing and engineering of lightweight metals company's three business segments--transportation and construction, global rolled products and engineered products and solutions--all beat revenue expectations. Arconic affirmed its guidance ranges for 2018 adjusted EPS of $1.17 to $1.27 and revenue of $13.7 billion to $14.0 billion, which compares with the FactSet consensus for EPS of $1.23 and for revenue of $13.84 billion. The stock has tumbled 23.5% year to date through Monday while the S&P 500 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, -0.71%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         has gained 4.8%.

author: EmilyBary
content:
Shares of Activision Blizzard Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    ATVI, +0.16%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         are up 1% in premarket trading after Needham analyst Laura Martin raised her price target on the stock to $90 from $80. She projects that Activision's Overwatch League, an esports venture, will add $464 million in incremental annual operating revenue on average over the next eight years. By 2024, which Martin sees as maturity for the Overwatch League, she estimates that the company will generate 45% of Overwatch League revenues from media rights fees and that incremental games sold will account for 22% of revenue. "In addition, we would posit that team sales are actually an annuity stream because Activision owned the IP [intellectual property] for 7 of the most popular esports titles in 2017," Martin wrote. "We believe that Activision will use its learnings from the Overwatch League (its first esports league) to roll out new esports leagues sequentially based on its other successful esports titles." For more on esports, see MarketWatch's preview of videogame-publisher earnings for this quarter. Activision shares are up 18% over the past 12 months, while the S&P 500 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, -0.71%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         has gained 13%.
title: Activision stock gains after Needham boosts price target on esports opportunities

content:
Qualcomm Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    QCOM, -0.40%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         said Tuesday morning that it had begin a "modified Dutch tender" offer so that it could buy back shares of its common stock worth up to $10 billion. The company said it would purchase shares at a price of $60 to $67.50. Shares are up 2.4% in premarket trading after the announcement. The offer is set to expire at the end of the day on Aug. 27, unless it is extended. "Qualcomm believes that the Offer represents an efficient mechanism to provide Qualcomm's stockholders with the opportunity to tender all or a portion of their stock and thereby receive a return of some or all of their investment in Qualcomm if they so elect," the company said in a release. The current offer is part of a larger $30 billion stock repurchase program that Qualcomm aims to complete by the end of fiscal 2019. Shares are up 17% over the past 12 months, while the S&P 500 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, -0.71%

content:

                                         shares slid 2.1% in Tuesday premarket trading after the consumer products company reported gave soft fiscal 2019 guidance. Net income totaled $1.89 billion, or 72 cents per share, down from $2.21 billion, or 82 cents per share, last year. P&G blamed the decline on "higher non-core restructuring charges and early debt extinguishment costs." Adjusted EPS was 94 cents. Revenue totaled $16.50 billion, up from $16.08 billion. The FactSet consensus was for EPS of 90 cents and revenue of $16.52 billion. Organic sales in the grooming segment and in the baby, feminine and family care segments fell. For fiscal 2019, P&G expects sales growth in the range of in-line to 1%. Adjusted EPS is expected to grow 3% to 8%, totaling $4.45 at the midpoint of the range. GAAP earnings are expected to increase 16% to 23%. The FactSet consensus is for sales of $67.78 billion, which implies 1.4% growth, and EPS of $4.39. P&G shares are down 12.7% for the year to date while the Dow Jones Industrial Average

author: CiaraLinnane
content:
Pfizer Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    PFE, -0.17%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         said Tuesday it had net income of $3.872 billion, or 65 cents a share, in the second quarter, up from $3.073 billion, or 51 cents a share, in the year-earlier period. Adjusted per-share earnings came to 81 cents, beating the FactSet consensus of 74 cents. Revenue rose to $13.466 billion from $12.896 billion, also ahead of the FactSet consensus of $13.298 billion. Chief Executive Ian Read said earnings were driven by the growth of key brands including Eliquis, Ibrance and Xeljanz, as well as biosimilars and emerging markets. "The performance of these growth drivers was partially offset by product losses of exclusivity, a decline in legacy Established Products in developed markets and ongoing legacy Hospira supply shortages,' he said in a statement. The company raised its full-year adjusted EPS outlook by 5 cents to $2.95 to $3.00. It lowered the midpoint of its full-year revenue guidance by $500 million to reflect the impact of the strong dollar. The company is now expecting revenue to range from $53.0 to $55.0 billion, compared with a previous forecast of $53.5 billion to $55.5 billion. Shares were slightly higher premarket and are up 6.5% in 2018, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average has gained 2.4% and the S&P 500 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, -0.71%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         has gained 4.8%.
title: Pfizer tops estimates for the second quarter and raises profit guidance

author: TomiKilgore
content:
Shares of Lumber Liquidators Holdings Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    LL, -1.71%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         plunged 9.8% in premarket trade Tuesday, after the wood flooring company reported a surprise second-quarter loss. The company swung to a net loss of $1.5 million, or 5 cents a share, from a profit of $4.5 million, or 16 cents a share, in the same period a year ago. That compared with the average analyst estimate for a profit of 25 cents a share, according to FactSet. Revenue rose 7.6% to $283.5 million, above the FactSet consensus of $281.3 million, as same-store sales growth of 4.7% beat expectations of a 3.0% rise. Gross margin decreased to 35.7% from 37%, as increased costs for transportation and inventory obsolescence and an unfavorable sales mix offset favorable revisions to anti-dumping rates. The company affirmed its 2018 outlook. Separately, the company said it was exiting the Bellawood products finishing business and will relocate its headquarters to Richmond, Virginia from Toano, Virginia. The stock has tumbled 22% year to date through Monday while the S&P 500 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, -0.71%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         has gained 4.8%.
title: Lumber Liquidators' stock plunges after surprise loss, while sales beat

author: MikeMurphy
content: There is evidence that North Korea is producing new missiles at the same facility that built intercontinental ballistic missiles that could reach the U.S., the Washington Post reported late Monday. According to the report, U.S. intelligence agencies, based on satellite photos and other evidence, believe one or two types of new ICBMs are being made at a facility outside Pyongyang. The range of the new missiles was not known, but the move is seen as a sign that North Korea's missile program is not slowing down, despite President Donald Trump's tweet in June that North Korea was "no longer a Nuclear Threat" following his summit with Kim Jong Un. Last week, Secretary of State Mike Pompeo testified on Capitol Hill that North Korea was still secretly producing "fissile material" used in nuclear weapons.
title: North Korea suspected to be building new ICBMs: report

author: JeremyC.Owens
content: A previous version of this article gave an incorrect figure for adjusted earnings as they would have been reported under the previous accounting standard. The previous figure was unadjusted earnings under the previous accounting standard. The article has been updated.
title: Rambus stock dips after first earnings since CEO departure

author: WallaceWitkowski
content:
KLA-Tencor Corp. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    KLAC, -2.18%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         shares rose in the extended session Monday after the equipment maker for the chip industry reported that quarterly results topped Wall Street estimates and forecast a strong outlook. KLA-Tencor shares rose 4% after hours, following a 1.2% decline to close the regular session at $106.30. The company reported fiscal fourth-quarter net income of $348.8 million, or $2.22 a share, compared with $256.2 million, or $1.62 a share, in the year-ago period. Revenue rose to $1.07 billion from $939 million in the year-ago period. Analysts surveyed by FactSet had estimated $2.13 a share on revenue of $1.05 billion. For the September-ending quarter, KLA-Tencor estimates adjusted earnings of $2.04 to $2.36 a share on revenue of $1.03 billion to $1.11 billion. Analysts expect earnings of $2.06 a share on revenue of $1.04 billion.
title: KLA-Tencor shares rise on earnings beat, strong outlook

author: ClaudiaAssis
content:
Shares of Chegg Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    CHGG, +2.68%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         rose more than 7% late Monday after the online education services company reported adjusted earnings and sales above Wall Street expectations. Chegg said it lost $3.91 million, or 3 cents a share, in the quarter, compared with a loss of $6.03 million, or 6 cents a share, in the year-ago period. Adjusted for one-time items, Chegg earned $15.5 million, or 12 cents a share, in the quarter, compared with $6 million, or 6 cents a share, a year ago. Revenue rose to $74.2 million from $56.3 million a year ago. Analysts polled by FactSet had expected Chegg to report adjusted earnings of 8 cents a share on sales of $70.2 million. The shares ended the regular trading day down 6.7%.
title: Chegg shares gain 7% after company earnings beat

author: WallaceWitkowski
content:
CBS Corp. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    CBS, -1.96%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         said Monday it will postpone its annual board meeting and that its board will appoint outsiders to conduct an "independent investigation" amid allegations surrounding Chief Executive Les Moonves. CBS shares were down less than 0.1% after hours, following a 5.1% drop to close the regular session at $51.28. Shares have been spiraling down, and have fallen nearly 11% since Friday following a report alleging that Moonves sexually harassed a half dozen women at the media company. Just before the market close, CBS said the board "is in the process of selecting outside counsel to conduct an independent investigation" and that "No other action was taken on this matter at today's board meeting." With its annual meeting scheduled for Aug. 10, CBS said it will postpone the meeting and will determine a new date for the meeting.
title: CBS appointing outside investigators for Moonves probe, postpones annual meeting

content:

content:

                                         shares dropped more than 9% in the extended session Monday after the restaurant company missed on the top and bottom line. The company reported second-quarter net income of $44.2 million, or 62 cents a share, compared with $37.6 million, or 53 cents a share, in the year-ago period. Revenue rose to $629.2 million from $566.3 million in the year-ago period. Analysts surveyed by FactSet had estimated earnings of 68 cents a share on revenue of $634.5 million. For the third quarter, analysts model earnings of 54 cents a share on revenue of $534 million. Texas Roadhouse shares closed down 2.6% to $66.10. Texas Roadhouse shares have gained 26% this year, with the S&P 500 index 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, -0.71%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         rising 4.8%.
title: Texas Roadhouse shares fall after earnings miss

author: ClaudiaAssis
content:
Shares of Illumina Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    ILMN, -0.97%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         rallied more than 7% late Monday after the genomics company reported better-than-expected second-quarter results and predicted 20% sales growth for the year. Illumina said it earned $209 million, or $1.41 a share, in the quarter, compared with $128 million, or 87 cents a share, in the year-ago period. Adjusted for one-time items, Illumina earned $212 million, or $1.43 a share, compared with $121 million, or 82 cents a share, a year ago. Revenue rose 25% to $830 million, from $662 million a year ago, thanks to "broad demand across applications, systems and geographies," the company said in a statement. Analysts polled by FactSet had expected adjusted earnings of $1.11 a share on sales of $787 million. Illumina said it expects revenue growth of about 20%, GAAP EPS between $5.10 and $5.20, and adjusted EPS between $5.35 and $5.45 for the year. The analysts surveyed by FactSet expect 2018 adjusted EPS of $4.87.
title: Illumina shares rally on company earnings, revenue outlook

author: GregRobb
content: The U.S. Treasury expects to borrow $329 billion in the July-September quarter, $56 billion more than previously estimated, according to a statement Monday. The new forecast includes an end-of-quarter cash balance of $350 billion. This is the largest borrowing in the third quarter since 2010 and is well above the $189 billion borrowed one year ago. Details of the borrowing will be released Wednesday. One of the reasons for the increased borrowing is that the Fed is not replacing as many securities on its balance sheet once they mature, allowing some to "roll off" under its new policy of quantitative tightening. Analysts at Jefferies estimated the government will end up borrowing over one trillion dollars this fiscal year, which ends Oct. 1. During the April-June quarter, Treasury borrowed $72 billion in net marketable debt and ended with a cash balance of $333 billion. This was slightly lower than the $75 billion estimated. During the October-December quarter, Treasury said it expects to borrow $440 billion in net marketable debt with a cash balance of $390 billion.
title: U.S. expects to borrow $329 billion in third quarter, largest borrowing in that period in eight years

author: MarkDeCambre
content:
Gold finished lower Monday, booking a third straight decline, as the precious metal encountered resistance amid rising U.S. government bond yields, even as the dollar softened. December gold, the most-active contract, finished $1.20, or less than 0.1%, lower at $1,231.50 an ounce. The decline marked the third consecutive for the precious metal and came even as the dollar weakened, as measured by the ICE U.S. Dollar Index 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    DXY, +1.40%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                        and the Dow Jones Industrial Average 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    DJIA, -0.77%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         and the S&P 500 index 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, -0.71%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         slumped. A weaker dollar usually makes bullion more appealing to buyers using other currencies, and gold tends to rise as stocks, viewed as risky assets, fall. The decline for gold comes a day ahead of a closely watched two-day gathering of the Federal Reserve, which isn't expected to yield major changes to policy, but may underscore the central bank's intent to lift rates twice more in 2018. Higher rates can undercut the appeal of commodities like gold that don't offer a yield. The 10-year benchmark Treasury yield 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    TMUBMUSD10Y, -0.41%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         has been climbing to around 3% in recent days.
title: Gold notches 3rd straight decline ahead of Fed gathering

author: RyanVlastelica
content:
The Cboe Volatility index jumped in afternoon trading on Monday, climbing as losses in the U.S. stock market accelerated. The VIX

                                         gained 10.7% to 14.43. Should Wall Street's so-called "fear index" settle at current levels, Monday would represent its biggest one-day percentage gain since June 27, and it would end at its highest level since July 5. The spike in the VIX, which which uses S&P 500 options to calculate expectations for volatility over the coming 30 days, came as technology stocks sold off for a third straight session. The VIX remains beneath its historical average between 19 and 20, but sharp jumps are notable, because the index has lingered in a relatively tight range in recent weeks.                                          shares broke above the $20 barrier for the first time in more than a decade Monday as the stock continued to rally after another analyst hiked their price target. AMD shares reached an intraday high of $20.18, and were last up 3.4% at $19.59, more than 20% higher since AMD's earnings report last week. Shares are on track for their highest close since January 2007, also the last time they traded above $20. On Monday, Cowen analyst Matthew Ramsay, who has a buy rating on AMD, hiked his price target on the stock to $25 from $21 on the basis that expected Intel Corp.

                                         product delays play right into upstart AMD's hands in the PC and data center market. "While it may take several quarters for these new 7nm products to materially impact financials, with Rome server and new Ryzen products launching during 1H19, we believe investors can now more securely invest in the bullish long-term thesis without the overhang of declining crypto-currency sales, or worries of a choppy gaming GPU channel," Ramsay said in a note. Of the 33 analysts who cover AMD, 13 have buy ratings, 14 have hold ratings, and six have sell ratings. Since AMD's earnings last week, 15 have raised their price targets to an average of $16.53, up from the average target of $14.88 before the earnings report. author: SarahToy
content:
After initially saying the board of CBS Corporation

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    CBS, -1.96%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         was suspending CEO Leslie Moonves following Friday's New Yorker report in which six women accused the chief executive of sexual harassment, USA Today corrected itself, saying a decision had not yet been made. In the article, four women described forcible touching or kissing during business meetings, and two women said Moonves physically intimidated them or threatened to derail their careers. "All allegations of personal misconduct are to be taken seriously," the CBS independent board of directors said in a statement on Friday. "Upon the conclusion of that investigation, which involves recently reported allegations that go back several decades, the Board will promptly review the findings and take appropriate action." CBS shares have fallen 9.1% to $51.78 since the news broke mid-day Friday. CBS shares have fallen 12.2% so far this year, while the S&P 500

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, -0.71%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         has gained 5.1%.
title: UPDATE: CBS board reviews CEO Leslie Moonves role after article detailing sexual harassment: USA Today

author: TomiKilgore
content:
Shares of U.S. Foods Holding Corp. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    USFD, -1.39%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         plunged 16% in morning trade Monday, putting them on track to suffer the biggest one-day loss since they went public in May 2016, after disappointing a second-quarter report and outlook overshadowed a $1.8 billion deal to buy Services Group of America's Food Group of Companies. The stock was also the biggest loser listed on the NYSE. Earlier Monday, the foodservice distributor reported second-quarter net income that rose to $126 million, or 58 cents a share, from $65 million, or 29 cents a share, in the same period a year ago. Excluding non-recurring items, adjusted earnings per share of 57 cents missed the FactSet consensus of 58 cents. Revenue was flat at $6.16 billion, while total case volume decreased 0.9%. The company said it expects 2018 total case volume to be about the same as last year, compared with previous guidance of 1% growth. Chief Executive Peter Satriano said on the post-earnings conference call with analysts that while he was disappointed with volume, he believes the factors causing this performance are "transitory in nature." The stock has now low 0.7% over the past three months, while the S&P 500

                                         has gained 6%.
title: U.S. Foods' stock plunges toward its biggest-ever decline as earnings, outlook disappoint

author: TomiKilgore
content:
Shares of Chesapeake Energy Corp. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    CHK, +0.65%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         shot up 4.4% in morning trade Monday, as analysts continued to give upbeat commentary on the oil and gas company's deal announced last week to sell its Utica shale position for $2 billion. Imperial Capital analyst Jason Wangler said the deal allows for "meaningful debt repayment," a reduction in midstream costs and allows the company to focus on production from the Powder River Basin. Wangler reiterated his in line rating, but his price target of $6 is 30% above current levels. Since Chesapeake announced the deal late Thursday, eight of the 25 analysts surveyed by FactSet have raised their stock price targets, moving that average target up to $4.67 from $4.03 at the end of June. On Friday, the shares had soared as much as 13% intraday before paring gains to close up 0.2%. The stock has run up 55% over the past three months, while the SPDR Energy Select Sector ETF

                                         has tacked on 6.2%.
title: Chesapeake Energy's stock surges in wake of Utica Shale asset sale

The stock has now fallen 22% from its record close of $217.50 on July 25, and will officially be in a bear market if it closes at that level. Many chart watchers say a new bear market starts after a fall of 20% or more from a bull-market high. Shares of Facebook sold off 19% in Thursday's session after the company delivered a sharp warning about its future revenue growth, and the stock dropped another 0.8% in Friday's session. The repurchases are part of a $10 billion program authorized in January 2014 that expires at the end of this year. At that point, Caterpillar will start a new $10 billion buyback program, effective Jan. 1, 2019, with no expiration date. Based on Friday's stock closing price of $142.56, the company could repurchase about 8.8 million shares, or roughly 1.5% of the shares outstanding, through the end of 2018. With the expected second-half purchases, Caterpillar will have spent about $7 billion of the $10 billion program. The stock surged 2.8% in premarket trade after the machinery maker reported second-quarter earnings that beat expectations and raised its 2018 outlook. author: TimRostan
content: Qatar's successful bid to host the 2022 World Cup was driven at least in part by propaganda campaigns against Australia and the U.S., the Persian Gulf nation's chief rivals to host soccer's glamorous quadrennial event, according to an anonymous whistle blower's reported account. The Guardian reported that a Conservative member of Parliament in the U.K. has called for a serious probe of the matter by the sport's governing body FIFA. The "black ops" campaigns against the U.S. and Australia, the Sunday Times reported, included a demonstration against Australia's hosting bid at a rugby match and an effort to organize American gym teachers to oppose the U.S. bid on the grounds that funds could be better used on youth sports. The effort also featured a recruitment of influential people to mount public opposition to the countries' bids and the funding of an academic study intended to show exorbitant costs associated with the U.S.'s securing hosting honors. The U.S. has subsequently seen its joint bid with Mexico and Canada to host the event in 2026 selected.
title: Whistle blower: Qatar ran 'black ops' against U.S. and Australia in support of its World Cup bid

author: CiaraLinnane
content: More than 500 hikers from France, Germany, the U.S., the Netherlands and Thailand, among other countries, are trapped on a mountain in Indonesia, after an earthquake started a landslide that has blocked their way down, according to media reports on Monday. A 6.4 magnitude earthquake hit the Indonesian island of Lombok on Sunday, trapping hikers on Mount Rinjani, an active volcano that is the second-tallest in Indonesia, according to Sky News, and a popular tourist destination for its breathtaking views. A full 800 people had registered to climb the mountain on Sunday, and about 300 made it back down before the earthquake hit, said reports. Helicopters were dropping supplies to the hikers, none of whom were reported to be injured. Indonesian president, Joko Widodo, arrived in Lombok on Monday to visit victims. "We must be aware that our country is in the Ring of Fire, so people need to be prepared to face any disaster," he said, according to Sky. The Ring of Fire is the name of an area in the Pacific that is home to many active earthquakes and volcanic activity.
title: More than 500 hikers trapped on a mountain in Indonesia after an earthquake

author: TonyaGarcia
content:
Tyson Foods Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    TSN, +0.80%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         shares sank 6.5% in Monday premarket trading after the company issued a profit warning for fiscal 2018, driven by uncertain trade policies and higher tariffs that impact domestic and export prices on items like chicken and pork. Tyson Foods brands include Ball Park and Jimmy Dean in addition to the namesake chicken products. The company now expects adjusted fiscal-year earnings of $5.70 to $6.00 per share, down from $6.55 to $6.70 per share. The FactSet consensus is for EPS of $6.55. Other drivers include commodity market volatility, "sluggish" domestic chicken demand, and compressed pork margins. "The combination of changing global trade policies here and abroad, and the uncertainty of any resolution, have created a challenging market environment of increased volatility, lower prices and oversupply of protein," said Tyson Chief Executive Tom Hayes in a statement. Tyson is off to a slow fourth-quarter start as a result of these market factors, he said. Tyson will report fiscal third-quarter results on August 6. Tyson shares are down 21.6% for the year so far while the S&P 500 index 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, -0.71%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         is up 5.4% for the period.
title: Tyson Foods shares sink after tariffs spur profit warning

author: TomiKilgore
content:

                                    CAT, -1.88%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         surged 3.2% in premarket trade Monday, after the machinery maker reported second-quarter earnings that beat expectations, and raised its full-year outlook. Net income rose to $1.71 billion, or $2.82 a share, from $802 million, or $1.35 a share, in the same period a year ago. Excluding non-recurring items, adjusted earnings per share came to $2.97, above the FactSet consensus of $2.75. The company expects the recently imposed tariffs to impact materials costs by $100 million to $200 million in the second half of 2018, while supply chain challenges are expected to keep pressuring freight costs. Caterpillar plans to offset these costs with price increases. Revenue grew to $14.01 billion from $11.33 billion, matching the FactSet consensus. Of Caterpillar's largest business segments, construction industries revenue rose 24% to $6.17 billion to beat the FactSet consensus of $6.01 billion and energy and transportation revenue increased 20% to $5.72 billion to beat expectations of $4.95 billion. The company raised its full-year adjusted EPS outlook to $11.00 to $12.00 from $10.25 to $11.25, compared with the FactSet consensus of $10.76. The stock has lost 9.5% year to date, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average

                                         has gained 3%.

author: AndreaRiquier
content:
Steve Eisman, an investor known for his correct bet against subprime mortgages a decade ago, told Bloomberg News that he's taken a position against Zillow Group Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    ZG, -3.89%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         calling its new venture into selling houses "a terrible business." That Zillow venture, then called "Instant Offers," was announced in April, to mixed analyst reviews. "We are big fans of this pivot," said Stephens' John Campbell at the time. A few weeks later, RBC Capital downgraded the stock, saying the shift into what is now called Zillow Offers set the company up for a "transition year" even as the stock remained overvalued. In response to a request for comment on Eisman's remarks, a Zillow spokeswoman emailed, "we think Zillow Offers is an attractive service for sellers in all types of housing markets. In a slower market, our offer might seem even more attractive to a seller." Zillow shares, which had been up more than 50% for the year to date, tumbled nearly 7% after Eisman's appearance.
title: Prominent short seller takes stake against Zillow as it starts to sell houses

                                         said Friday it will investigate allegations of misconduct made against Chief Executive Les Moonves by The New Yorker in an article written by Ronan Farrow that is expected to be published later Friday. "All of personal misconduct are to be taken seriously," CBS said in a statement. "Upon the conclusion of that investigation, which involves recently reported allegations that go back several decades, the Board will promptly review the findings and take appropriate action," it added. The Hollywood Reporter earlier said that the New Yorker report discusses allegations of instances of unwanted kissing and touching over two decades ago. This comes at a difficult time for Moonves, who is currently engaged in a contentious legal battle with Shari Redstone, the controlling shareholder of CBS and Viacom 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    VIAB, +0.00%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         over the future of the company. CBS noted its "very public legal dispute." While "that litigation process continues, the CBS management team has the full support of the independent board members," said the statement. Shares fell 5.3% on the news and are down 7.6% in 2018, while the S&P 500 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, -0.71%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         has gained 5.4%.
title: CBS says it will investigate claims of improper conduct against CEO Les Moonves

author: CiaraLinnane
content:
Shares of biotech Insys Therapeutics Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    INSY, -0.27%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         slid 7.6% Friday, after the company said the U.S. Food and Drug Administration has declined to approve its new drug application for a spray that treats pain and could offer an alternative to opioids. The company said it has received a Complete Response Letter from the regulator regarding a buprenorphine sublingual spray as a treatment for moderate-to-severe acute pain. Although three doses of the product showed statistically different response than placebo in clinical trials, some of the data suggested potential safety concerns. "Given the attributes of our proprietary buprenorphine formulation for sublingual delivery, we continue to believe that this drug-device combination could bring value to the management of pain and will assess the next steps in the context of the company's overall mission," said Steve Sherman, senior vice president of regulatory affairs for INSYS Therapeutics. Insys shares have fallen 30.0% in 2018, while the S&P 500 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, -0.71%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         has gained 5.3%.
title: Insys shares slide 7.6% after FDA rejects its spray treatment for pain

author: SteveGoldstein
content: Consumer sentiment fell in July, the University of Michigan said. The index fell to 97.9 from 98.2 in June, as both the assessment of current economic conditions and expectations fell. Economists expected a 97.3 reading. "Despite the expectation of higher inflation and higher interest rates during the year ahead, consumers have kept their confidence at high levels due to favorable job and income prospects," the University of Michigan said.
title: Consumer sentiment slips in July to six-month low

content:
Facebook Inc. in early Friday trade saw its shares take a tentative step higher, a day after the social-media giant registered its worst one-day loss as a public company and shed $120 billion in market value, representing one of the ugliest drops for a large-capitalization entity in the U.S. Facebook's shares

It's losses came after it reported quarterly results that offered a lower outlook for ad revenues in the wake of its Cambridge Analytica scandal. For the week, Facebook's shares are down 15%, while it is slightly positive for 2018, up 0.8% with Friday's rise. author: RobertSchroeder
content: President Donald Trump on Friday hailed second-quarter gross domestic product growth of 4.1% as "amazing," and said such a pace was "very sustainable." Speaking at the White House, Trump said "this isn't a one-time shot." Economists, meanwhile, are not convinced that that pace will last.
title: Trump calls GDP report 'amazing' and says growth rate is sustainable
