title: Rambus fires chief executive for improper conduct

author: TomiKilgore
content:
The Dow Jones Utility Average 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    DJU, -0.54%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         slipped less than 0.1% Thursday, to snap a 10-session win streak, the longest such streak since October 2006. The index was up as much as 0.9% earlier in the session, which set it up for the longest win streak (11 sessions) since July 1992, but some late-day weakness turned the index lower. The utilities sector tends to outperform the broader market in the late stages of a business cycle and in a recession, given the defensive nature of the sector, and because falling Treasury yields tend to make the relatively high dividend yields of utilities stocks more attractive. The implied dividend yield of the Dow utilities (DJU) is 3.32%, while the implied yield for the Dow Jones Industrial Average 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    DJIA, -0.77%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         is 2.04%. Strangely, the DJU's win streak started the day after the Federal Reserve raised its fed funds target range by 25 basis points to 1.75% to 2.00%; that's because the yield on the 10-year Treasury note has declined by 13 basis points since the Fed hiked rates. On Thursday, the yield edged up 7.1 basis points to 2.847%. The DJU has gained 2.4% this month, while the Dow industrials has slipped 0.8%.
title: Dow utilities snaps longest losing streak in nearly 12 years

author: RobertSchroeder
content: A shooting has reportedly occurred at the Capital Gazette newspaper in Annapolis, Md. A reporter for the newspaper told the Baltimore Sun that multiple people had been shot. A spokesman for the Anne Arundel County Police Department said officers are searching the building where the shooting was reported, and that the situation is "active and ongoing."
title: Shooting reported at newspaper in Annapolis, Md.

author: RobertSchroeder
content: White House chief of staff John Kelly is expected to leave his position this summer, after a year in the job, The Wall Street Journal reported. President Donald Trump is consulting advisers about a possible replacement, the report said. Office of Management and Budget chief Mick Mulvaney and Nick Ayers, now Vice President Mike Pence's chief of staff, are the two front-runners for Kelly's job, people familiar with the matter told the Journal.
title: White House chief of staff Kelly expected to leave this summer: WSJ

author: CiaraLinnane
content:
Bonds issued by a slew of health care companies were slammed Thursday, after the news that Amazon.com Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    AMZN, -0.64%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         is buying PillPack, confirming its ambitions to become a player in the pharmacy market. The news comes after more than a year of speculation that the e-commerce giant was targeting the sector as its next area of expansion. PillPack packages medications by dose and delivers them directly to patients, along with other products like vitamins, inhalers and testing supplies. The service is particularly geared toward those who must take several medications daily, including individuals with chronic conditions and seniors. The news sent health care stocks sharply lower, and their bonds fell in tandem. CVS Health Corp.'s 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    CVS, +0.70%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         4.300% notes that mature in March 2028, were most active, widening 7 basis points to a yield spread of 165 basis points over Treasurys. The drug-store chain's 5.050% notes widened by 8 basis points to 198 basis points over Treasurys and its 4.780% notes due March of 2038 widened by 10 basis points to 190 basis points over Treasurys. Pharmacy-benefits manager Express Scripts 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    ESRX, +2.22%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         4.800% notes due July 2046 widened 19 basis points to 225 basis points over Treasurys. Walgreens Boots Alliance 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    WBA, +0.48%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         3.450% notes that mature in June of 2026 were 14 basis points wider.
title: Amazon's move into pharmacy slams health care bonds

author: TonyaGarcia
content:
Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    CMG, -0.45%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         shares sank 7.4% in Thursday trading following the highly-anticipated after-hours investor update call that analysts say lacked detail. Among the announcements, Chipotle said it would close 55 to 65 stores and add digital capabilities to modernize the restaurant experience. "Chipotle's investor call outlined strategic initiatives, but didn't provide much visibility into the potential and timing of an improved sales and earnings trajectory," wrote UBS analysts, who rate Chipotle shares sell. They have a $300 price target on Chipotle stock. AB Bernstein is more upbeat, writing that first-quarter sales trends have continued into the second quarter. "Chipotle's focus is appropriately on driving topline to support an improved economic model," analysts led by Sara Senatore wrote. AB Bernstein rates Chipotle outperform with a $500 target price. Chipotle shares have gained 46.5% for the year to date, while the S&P 500 index 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, -0.71%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         is up 1.4%.
title: Chipotle shares sink 7.4% after analysts say investor update lacked detail

Gold futures declined Thursday for a fourth session in a row, as overall strength in the U.S. dollar for the week and the month continued to dull investment demand for the metal, despite ongoing concerns on global trade. author: TomiKilgore
content:
Facebook Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    FB, -1.55%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         said Thursday that it is taking "significant steps" to bring more transparency to ads and Pages on the social media site, which should increase accountability for advertisers and prevent abuse. Users will now be able to see ads running across Facebook, Instagram, Messenger and its partner network, even if those ads aren't shown to the user. In addition, users will be able to see any recent name changes and the date the Page was created. "By shining a bright light on all ads, as well as the Pages that run them, we'll make it easier to root out abuse--helping to ensure that bad actors are held accountable for the ads they run," Facebook said in a statement. The stock slipped 0.2% in afternoon trade. It has rallied 28% over the past three months, while the S&P 500 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, -0.71%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         has gained 4%.
title: Facebook steps up efforts to increase accountability for advertisers, prevent abuse

author: TonyaGarcia
content:
Adidas AG's 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    ADS, +1.02%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         sales outlook is at risk thanks to the ouster of the German team from World Cup competition, wrote Wedbush analysts led by Christopher Svezia. Germany is the athletic company's top sponsored team, the country is the company's top market, and the World Cup is a major sales driver. In the second half of 2014 when Germany won, incremental jersey sales rose 10%. The early elimination could have a low-single-digit impact on Western European sales mostly in the third quarter, analysts say, after "softer growth" in the second quarter. "The best case for the region's sales going forward would now be for Spain to advance toward the final or win the World Cup," Wedbush wrote. Analysts rate Adidas' shares neutral with a target price of €180. Adidas also announced a potential data breach in the U.S. on Thursday. Shares are down 2.7% in Thursday trading, but have rallied 10% for the year to date. The S&P 500 index 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, -0.71%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         is up 1.3% for 2018 so far.
title: Adidas sales outlook at risk after Germany ousted from World Cup competition, analysts say

author: CiaraLinnane
content:
Tesla Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    TSLA, +0.86%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         will likely release its second-quarter delivery numbers by Tuesday, July 3, Baird analysts said Thursday, and they are buyers into the release. Baird rates Tesla stock outperform and has designated it a fresh pick, meaning it deems the stock a high-conviction investment based on fundamental or quantitative factors until a specified expiration date. "The primary focus will likely be on exit rate Model 3 production, and we believe shares could trade higher if the company approaches its targets," analysts led by Ben Kallo wrote in a note. "Additionally, we believe investors will look for total Model 3s produced in June (if the company releases June data) in an effort to gauge steady-state production rates." Baird is expecting deliveries of about 25,000 vehicles with more in the channel, although the focus will be more on production than delivery. The FactSet consensus is for 28,000 Model 3 deliveries, out of 51,000 vehicles in total. "Consensus estimates for Q2 deliveries may be too high, particularly given our belief there could be a larger-than-normal delta between production and deliveries due to the ramp during the quarter," said Kallo. "That said, Elon Musk's recent email could indicate the company is tracking ahead of consensus expectations." Tesla shares were up 3.2% on Thursday, and have gained 14% in 2018, while the S&P 500 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, -0.71%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         has gained 1.2%.
title: Baird remains bullish on Tesla ahead of Q2 deliveries expected by next Tuesday

author: TonyaGarcia
content:
Adidas AG 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    xe:

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         said Thursday that it is alerting some customers who have purchased from Adidas U.S. website of a potential data breach. "On June 26, Adidas became aware that an unauthorized party claims to have acquired limited data associated with certain Adidas customers," the alert said. The data includes contact information, usernames and encrypted passwords. Adidas says it doesn't believe credit card or fitness information was impacted. The company is taking steps to understand "the scope of the issue" and is working with data security firms and law enforcement on the issue. Adidas shares are down 2.7% in Thursday trading, but have rallied 10% for the year so far. The S&P 500 index 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, -0.71%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         is up 1.2% for 2018 to date.
title: Adidas warns about a potential data breach

author: SarahToy
content:
DC Entertainment has begun accepting sign-ups for a beta version of its digital subscription service, dubbed DC Universe, the company announced Thursday. The beta version will launch in August, and a full launch will follow later in the fall. DC Entertainment is a subsidiary of Time Warner Inc., which was recently acquired by AT&T

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    T, -0.71%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         and renamed WarnerMedia. The subscription service will give fans access to new live-action and animated series, previously-released TV series and films and a curated, rotating selection of digital comic books, the company said. The platform will feature a social-media element where fans can connect with each other, earn rewards and participate in sweepstakes and contests. There will be shopping opportunities, as well. DC has not announced pricing yet, but is planning to launch DC Universe on iOS, Android, Roku

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    ROKU, +1.27%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         Apple TV

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    AAPL, -0.30%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         Amazon Fire TV

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    AMZN, -0.64%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         Android TV and the web, the company said. Shares of AT&T have fallen 18.3% so far this year, while the S&P 500

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, -0.71%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         has gained 1.3%.
title: DC Entertainment to launch digital subscription service in August

author: TonyaGarcia
content:
Walmart Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    WMT, +1.31%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         is adding two features to its e-commerce site's home shopping section, especially for dorm rooms and small living spaces. Starting Thursday, shoppers can take a 3D Virtual Shopping Tour that highlights nearly 70 items. And starting in July, customers can "Buy the Room," curated collections that can be purchased together as a complete look. Initially, there will be five collections, each featuring up to 20 items for college dorm rooms. Walmart says it will listen to customer feedback to see where the tools can apply to other living areas. Walmart launched Allswell, a digital home brand comprised of bedding and mattresses, in February. Walmart shares are down 12.6% for the year to date while the Dow Jones Industrial Average 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    DJIA, -0.77%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         is down 2.4% for the period.
title: Walmart adds 3D feature to online home shopping

author: CiaraLinnane
content:
Shares of Arsanis Inc., a clinical-stage biotech, slid 73% in premarket trade Thursday, after the company said it is discontinuing a Phase 2 trial of a treatment for pneumonia in high-risk, mechanically ventilated patients after determining that it was unlikely to meet its main goals. The trial sought to evaluate ASN100 in reducing S. aureus pneumonia compared to placebo. "We are disappointed that this clinical study was futile despite the survival benefit of ASN100 as compared to placebo observed in preclinical models of pneumonia, however Arsanis remains confident in the potential of monoclonal antibodies to prevent and treat serious infections, while also reducing the threat of antibiotic resistance," said René Russo, chief executive of Arsanis. The company will now focus its efforts on the development of ASN500 for the prevention of respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) infection, which contributes to 240,000 hospitalizations a year in the U.S. Shares have gained 43% in 2018 through Wednesday, while the S&P 500 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, -0.71%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         has gained 1%.
title: UPDATE: Arsanis shares slide 73% on news to discontinue trial of pneumonia treatment

author: TonyaGarcia
content:
Amazon.com Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    AMZN, -0.64%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         shared more news on Thursday with the launch of the new Fire HD 10 Kids Edition tablet, selling for about $200. The tablet includes 32 GB of storage and up to 10 hours of battery life. The tablet also comes with a year of Amazon FreeTime Unlimited, offering more than 15,000 books videos, educational apps and games. More than 10 million kids have used the FreeTime service, which includes parental controls like limits on screen time and age filters. Amazon also announced the new Show Mode and Show Mode Charging Dock for Fire tablets that uses Alexa voice control for a hands-free experience. Alexa was introduced on the Fire 10 tablet last year. Amazon shares have gained 42.5% for the year to date, while the S&P 500 index 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, -0.71%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         is up 0.7% for the period.
title: Amazon introduces kids Fire tablet, adds new mode to other Fire tablets

author: RyanVlastelica
content:
The Cboe Volatility Index rose on Thursday, extending a recent advance that has put Wall Street's so-called "fear index" on track to end at a two-month high. The VIX 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    VIX, +10.56%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         which uses S&P 500 options to calculate expectations for volatility over the coming 30 days, rose 4.4% to 18.68. While the index has twice topped this level on an intraday basis in the past couple of weeks, settling at its current level would represent its highest close since April 11. The Volatility Index has risen of late, tracking a general decline in the equity market that has been largely fueled by uncertainty over trade policy. The VIX is up 33.6% thus far this week, compared with the 1.9% decline of the S&P 500. The Cboe index has jumped about 40% over the past month, a move that has brought its year-to-date climb to about 67%. Despite those gains, it remains below its long-term average, which is between 19 and 20. The Dow Jones Industrial Average 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    DJIA, -0.77%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         fell 0.1% on Thursday while the S&P 500 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, -0.71%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         rose less than 0.1% and the Nasdaq Composite Index 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    COMP, -0.67%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         gained 0.1%.
title: Wall Street's 'fear index' rises, could settle at a two-month high

content:
BJ's Wholesale Club Holdings Inc. shares

                                         surged more than 23% Thursday in their first day of trading after returning to the public market. The company, which was taken private in 2011, priced its initial public offering at $17 a share, at the high end of its $15 to $17 range. The offering of more than 37.5 million shares raised $637.5 million. Shares are trading on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol "BJ." The company, a rival of Costco Wholesale Corp., operates 215 warehouse clubs across 16 states. Bank of America Merrill Lynch, Deutsche Bank Securities, Goldman Sachs & Co. and J.P. Morgan are serving as joint lead book-runners. Proceeds of the deal will be used to pay down debt. The S&P 500

author: TonyaGarcia
content:
Mattel Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    MAT, +0.70%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         was downgraded to underperform from neutral at D.A. Davidson on concerns about sales and earnings in the coming quarters. D.A. Davidson has a 12-to-18 month price target of $12 on Mattel stock. Shares are down 4% in Thursday trading. Mattel faces a tough comparison with "Cars 3" and disruption from the Toys 'R' Us liquidation, analysts say. And raw material inflation, which hurt gross margin in the first quarter, will continue to have an impact in the second quarter. D.A. Davidson expects a 31-cent-per-share loss in the second quarter and a sales decline of 13%. The FactSet consensus is for a loss of 29 cents per share and sales of $855.6 million, down from $974.5 million last year. Mattel shares are up 4.8% for the year so far, outpacing the S&P 500 index 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, -0.71%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         which is up 1% for the period.
title: Mattel shares slip after downgrade on sales risk from Toys 'R' Us liquidation

author: SteveGoldstein
content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission and a parallel criminal action has been brought against Sudhakar Reddy Bonthu, a former Equifax 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    EFX, -0.03%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         software engineering manager, for allegedly trading on inside information of the company's data breach. That's the second insider-trading case on the Equifax breach the SEC has brought. According to the complaint, Bonthu violated company policy when he traded on the non-public information by purchasing Equifax put options. Less than a week later, after Equifax publicly announced the data breach and its stock declined nearly 14%, Bonthu sold the put options and netted more than $75,000, the SEC said. He was terminated by Equifax in March after not cooperating with the company's internal investigation.
title: SEC brings second insider-trading case over Equifax data breach

author: TomiKilgore
content:
Shares of Scana Corp. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SCG, -0.68%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         dropped 3.8% in premarket trade Thursday, after the South Carolina-based electric and natural gas utility said it slashed its quarterly dividend by 80%. The new quarterly dividend of 12.37 cents a share, down from 61.25 cents a share, will payable July 18 to shareholders of record on July 10. "The board made this reduction to preserve its options as the Company continues to seek a resolution to the recovery of costs for the VC Summer new nuclear construction project," the company said in a statement. Based on Wednesday's stock closing price of $36.79, the new annual dividend rate implies a dividend yield of 1.34%, down from 6.66%. That compares with the yields for the SPDR Utilities Select Sector ETF

                                         of 1.97%. Scana shares have tumbled 46% over the past 12 months, while the utilities ETF has slipped 1.1% and the S&P 500 has gained 11%.
title: Scana slashes quarterly dividend 80%

author: EmilyBary
content:
Shares of Madison Square Garden Co. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    MSG, +0.31%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         are up more than 10% in premarket trading after the company said it received board approval to explore the possibility of spinning off its sports businesses into a separate company. Jefferies analyst John Janedis upgraded the stock to buy from hold on Thursday, raising his price target to $350 from $233. "MSG possesses a collection of unique, world class sports and entertainment assets which are largely underappreciated by investors," Janedis wrote. "As MSG intends to separate the Sports and Entertainment businesses in a tax-free spin, we expect the discount to fair value to narrow and shares to better reflect the considerable intrinsic value of the assets." MSG shares were up 33% over the past 12 months, as of Wednesday's close, while the S&P 500 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, -0.71%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         had gained 11%.
title: MSG stock gains after Jefferies upgrades to buy on spin potential

content:

The company has launched a external search for a new CFO. Maw had joined Starbucks in 2011 as global controller, and was promoted to CFO in February 2014. Just prior to the CFO announcement, the stock was up less than 0.1% in premarket trade. Earlier this month, executive chairman Howard Schultz said he was stepping down. Excluding non-recurring items, the adjusted loss per share was 1 cent, matching the FactSet consensus. Revenue slipped to $5.39 billion from $5.44 billion, just above the FactSet consensus of $5.33 billion. Retail pharmacy same-store sales fell 0.7%, as front-end sales declined 1.8% and pharmacy sales slipped 0.1%. The pharmacy sales decline includes a 1.33 percentage points negative impact from new generic introductions. For fiscal 2019, revenue is expected to be $21.7 billion to $22.1 billion, which doesn't include the impact of the impending acquisition of Albertons. J.P. Morgan reiterated its neutral rating on Rite Aid, saying the shares aren't trading on fundamentals given the pending Albertsons deal. author: TomiKilgore
content:

The results come as the drug store chain also said it raised its dividend and set a new $10 billion stock repurchase program. The stock fell 1.2% in premarket trade, reversing earlier gains of up to 1.9%. Net income for the quarter to May 31 rose to $1.34 billion, or $1.35 a share, from $1.16 billion, or $1.07 a share, in the same period a year ago. Excluding non-recurring items, adjusted earnings per share rose 15% to $1.53, above the FactSet consensus of $1.48. Sales grew 14% to $34.33 billion, beating the FactSet consensus of $34.10 billion. Retail pharmacy USA sales rose 15% to $25.9 billion, in line with the FactSet consensus, while same-store sales for the segment decreased 1.2%. The company raised its fiscal 2018 adjusted EPS guidance range to $5.90 to $6.05 from $5.85 to $6.05. The stock has shed 8.8% year to date through Wednesday, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average

                                         said Thursday they have agreed to merge in an all-stock deal that will create a company focused on chronic kidney disease. The companies said the new entity will have pro forma equity value of about $1.3 billion, assuming full conversion of outstanding Keryx convertible notes. The new company will be called Akebia Therapeutics Inc. Under the terms of the deal, Keryx shareholders will recieve 0.37433 common share of Akebia for each Keryx share owned. Akebia CEO John Butler will lead the combined company and Keryx will appoint the chairman of the board. The deal is expected to close by year-end. "Combining Akebia and Keryx is expected to create a sustainable, kidney disease-focused, therapeutic leader that is well positioned to be a partner of choice throughout the renal community and for companies with products for patients with kidney disease," the companies said in a joint statement. Bot stocks were halted premarket for the news. Akebia has fallen 30.2% in the year through Wednesday, while Keryx has fallen 3.7%. The new dividend of 44 cents a share, up from 40 cents, will be payable Sept. 12 to shareholders of record on Aug. 20. Based on Wednesday's stock closing price of $66.26, the new annual dividend rate implies a dividend yield of 2.66%, compared with the implied yield for the Dow Jones Industrial Average

Based on Wednesday's stock closing price, the new $10 billion program would represent about 150.9 million shares, or about 15% of the shares outstanding. The stock's premarket price gain would add about 7 points to the Dow, while Dow futures rose about 17 points.

author: CiaraLinnane
content:
Eli Lilly and Co. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    LLY, +0.06%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         announced positive results Thursday in a midstage trial of a treatment for Ankylosing Spondylitis, an inflammatory disease that can cause some of the vertebrae in the spine to fuse. The company said the trial of Taltz met its primary and secondary endpoints, showing a statistically significant improvement in the signs and symptoms of the disease at 16 weeks, compared with placebo. "These positive results, in combination with previous results from the Phase 3 COAST-V study, provide further support for Taltz as a potential treatment option for patients with AS, including those who have had an inadequate response to treatment with TNF inhibitors, a difficult-to-treat population," said Dr. Lotus Mallbris, vice president, Immunology Development, at Eli Lilly. The company is planning to submit data from the trial at scientific meetings and peer-reviewed journals later this year and expects to submit is for U.S. regulatory approval later this year. Taltz is already approved for treating adults with active psoriatic arthritis. Shares were not yet active premarket, but have gained 0.3% in 2018, while the S&P 500 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, -0.71%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         has gained 1%.
title: Eli Lilly reports positive results in trial of treatment for Ankylosing Spondylitis

author: MikeMurphy
content: BJ's Wholesale Club announced the pricing of its initial public offering late Wednesday at $17 a share, on the high end of its range. The offering of more than 37.5 million shares would raise $637.5 million. Shares are expected to begin trading Thursday on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol "BJ." The company, a rival of Costco Wholesale Corp., operates 215 warehouse clubs across 16 states. Bank of America Merrill Lynch, Deutsche Bank Securities, Goldman Sachs & Co. and J.P. Morgan are serving as joint lead book-runners.
title: BJ's Wholesale Club prices IPO at $17 a share

author: JeremyC.Owens
content:
Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    CMG, -0.45%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         shares dropped in after-hours trading Wednesday after the restaurant chain's top executives detailed restructuring plans that include closing dozens of locations. New Chief Executive Brian Niccol and other executives held a conference call Thursday afternoon to discuss changes under the new management team, which included plans to add delivery options to the chain's mobile app and areas specifically for picking up food at stores. Shares turned lower after Chief Financial Officer John Hartung detailed the costs of restructuring and revealed that Chipotle plans to close 55 to 65 stores. "In aggregate, we expect these costs to be in the range of $115 million to $135 million," Hartung said, with $50 million to $60 million recorded in the second quarter and most of the rest in the second half of 2018. Hartung said about half of the closures will happen in the next 30 days, while those closures that involve more complicated lease buyouts will stretch longer. Hartung stressed that Chipotle was not updating nor reaffirming its financial guidance, but outlining non-recurring charges. Shares declined 2.9% in late trading, after closing with a 1% decline at $457.24. The stock has rebounded since Niccol was brought in from Taco Bell as the new CEO, and has gained 58.2% so far this year as the S&P 500 index 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, -0.71%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         has increased 1.9%.
title: Chipotle plans to close stores in restructuring, stock falls

Same-store sales for the first quarter declined 8.2% while analysts were expecting a decline of 7.7%.

content:
Madison Square Garden Co.

                                         said late Wednesday that the board approved plans to examine spinning-off its sports businesses that include the New York Knicks and New York Rangers into a separate publicly traded company. Madison Square Garden stock is up 1.8% in the extended session after closing down 2% to $266.23 during regular trading. "We are exploring the opportunity to further create value by separating our businesses into two distinct companies," Chief Executive James Dolan and is expected to be executive chairman and CEO of both organizations, the company said in a statement. "We believe this proposed transaction would provide each company with enhanced strategic flexibility, its own defined business focus and clear investment characteristics." The company said the transaction would be tax-free for shareholders, who would receive proportional distribution expected to be equivalent to two-thirds of the sports spin-off. The live entertainment company is expected to include venues such as New York's Madison Square Garden, its sports bookings unit, a one-third interest in the sports spin-off and about $1 billion in cash on hand. content:
Bed Bath & Beyond Inc.

                                         shares fell in the extended session Wednesday after the housewares retailer's earnings topped Wall Street estimates but same-store sales did not. Bed Bath & Beyond shares fell 6.8% after hours, following a 0.7% gain to close at $20.18 in the regular session. The company reported fiscal first-quarter net income of $43.6 million, or 32 cents a share, compared with $75.3 million, or 53 cents a share, in the year-ago period. First-quarter earnings included a 6-cents-a-share charge from severance costs and a 5-cents-a-share benefit from new accounting standards. Revenue rose to $2.75 billion from $2.74 billion in the year-ago period. Analysts surveyed by FactSet had estimated 31 cents a share on revenue of $2.75 billion. Same-store sales for the first quarter, however, declined 0.6% while analysts were expecting a gain of 0.1%. For the year, Bed Bath & Beyond estimates earnings in the low-to-mid $2-a-share range with analysts estimating earnings of $2.27 a share.
title: Bed Bath & Beyond shares fall as same-store sales decline

author: GregRobb
content: St. Louis Fed President James Bullard said Wednesday that the Fed's benchmark interest rate could already be at a neutral level and the central bank may go "too far" if it stays on its path of further rate hikes. "A misinterpretation of where we are is a distinct possibility," Bullard said, in an interview with the Wall Street Journal. "That's why I'm trying to push against faster rate hikes," he said. Earlier this month, the Fed lifted the benchmark rate to a range between 1.75% and 2% and penciled in two more rate hikes this year. Bullard, who has been arguing for going slow on rates all year, said he thinks the neutral rate might be 2%. The majority of Fed officials think the neutral rate is closer to 3%.
title: Fed could already be at neutral, Bullard says in WSJ interview

The announcement early Wednesday suggested a less-stringent tacked than had originally been anticipated by President Donald Trump. The news underscore a back-and-forth battle over trade imbalances between China and the U.S., which has rattled investor sentiment. author: TomiKilgore
content:
The Dow Jones Utility Average 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    DJU, -0.54%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         rose 0.7% in afternoon trade toward a 10th-straight gain, which would match the longest win streak in nearly 12 years. Because utilities tend to have high dividend yields and are also less volatile than growth stocks, the sector often acts as a proxy for the bond market. As interest rates rise, and bond prices fall, investors often shed utilities because the incentive to accept higher equity risk for higher yields is diminished; when interest rates fall, utilities tend to rally as investors look for higher yields. The Dow utilities current win streak comes, however, after the Federal Reserve raised its fed funds target rate to 1.75% to 2.00% on June 13, the second rate hike this year, and signaled that there could be two more hikes later this year. Meanwhile, the yield on the 10-year Treasury note has declined 15.1 basis points since June 13 to 2.826%. Around the 10-day win streak ending Oct. 23, 2006, the fed funds rate had already peaked and the Fed said the housing market was a "significant drag" on economic activity. The Dow utilities has an implied dividend yield of 3.31%, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    DJIA, -0.77%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         has an implied yield of 2.19%.
title: Dow Jones Utility Average rallies toward 10th-straight gain, longest streak in nearly 12 years

author: MyraP.Saefong
content:
U.S. benchmark oil futures rallied Wednesday after a U.S. government report revealed a drop of 9.9 million barrels in last week's crude supplies-the largest weekly decline of the year so far. Traders were also concerned about further tightness in global supplies linked to U.S. sanctions on Iranian oil. August West Texas Intermediate crude 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    clq8

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         jumped $2.23, or 3.2%, to settle at $72.76 a barrel on the New York Mercantile Exchange. That was the highest finish for a most-active contract since Nov. 26, 2014, according to FactSet data.
title: U.S. oil prices score highest finish since 2014

author: RobertSchroeder
content: Supreme Court Justice Anthony Kennedy said Wednesday he will retire, in a move that will give President Donald Trump his second pick for the high court. The 81-year-old Kennedy is sometimes the court's swing voter on controversial decisions. The Supreme Court recessed for its current term earlier Wednesday.
title: Supreme Court Justice Anthony Kennedy says he's retiring

The department's antitrust division filed a lawsuit on Wednesday to block the acquisition, but also filed a proposed settlement it said would resolve the competitive harm alleged in its lawsuit. The Justice Department alleged in the lawsuit that since Disney and Fox compete to sell cable sports programming to multichannel video programming distributors in local markets across the U.S., the acquisition would likely end up in multichannel video programming distributors paying higher prices in those markets. Disney shares are down 1.9% so far this year, while Fox shares are up 40.5%. The stock was up 0.1% just prior to Trump's tweet, then was down less than 0.1% several minutes later, before bouncing back into positive territory, and then some. Trump's tweet, which repeats tweets he sent on Tuesday, followsthe company's announcement earlier this week that it would eat the near-term costs of EU tariffs, which were imposed in retaliation of steel and aluminum tariffs imposed by Trump on the EU, but said it planned to move some production of EU-bound motorcycles overseas over the longer-term to avoid the EU tariffs. author: RobertSchroeder
content: The White House and the Kremlin have agreed on a time and place for a summit between Presidents Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin, according to a Russian official. Kremlin foreign policy aide Yuri Ushakov told reporters the summit would be held in a "third country" and details would be announced Thursday. The meeting is expected to be held in mid-July, when Trump will be in Europe on a previously scheduled visit.
title: U.S., Russia agree on time, place for Trump-Putin meeting, official says

author: TonyaGarcia
content:
Amazon.com Inc.

                                         announced new Back to School and Off to College online stores on Wednesday. The press statement focused on low prices for all of the supplies and gear that both parents and educators will need for the coming season. This year, Amazon introduced an option to allow teens ages 13 through 17 to shop independently on the Amazon app, with parents either approving each order or setting spending limits for their children. College students can also rent or purchase textbooks. "Amazon's announcement today of its 'full force launch' of the back-to-school/back-to-college season highlights what is sure to be a highly-competitive season for 2018, with Prime Day just around the corner as well," said Charlie O'Shea, Moody's lead retail analyst, in a note. Amazon shares are up 46% for the year to date while the S&P 500 index 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, -0.71%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         is up 2.6% for the period.
title: Amazon goes back to school with new online stores

author: RobertSchroeder
content: The Supreme Court recessed for its current term on Wednesday, announcing no justices' retirement decisions. The end of the high court's term had been watched for possible retirements by either Anthony Kennedy or Clarence Thomas, either of which would allow President Donald Trump to nominate a justice of his choosing.
title: Supreme Court recesses without announcing any justices' retirements

author: RobertSchroeder
content: The Supreme Court ruled Wednesday that public employee unions cannot require non-members to pay fees. The decision was 5-4. "We conclude that this arrangement violates the free speech rights of nonmembers by compelling them to subsidize private speech on matters of substantial public concern," wrote Justice Samuel Alito. The case is Janus vs. the American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees.
title: Supreme Court rules in Janus case public employee unions can't charge fees to non-members

author: RyanVlastelica
content:
The largest exchange-traded fund to track the financial sector fell on Wednesday, putting it on track to extend a string of declines that stand as the longest in its history. The Financial Select Sector SPDR ETF

                                         fell 0.1% on Wednesday. Should it close in negative territory, that would count as its 13th straight daily drop; the previous record for such a streak was eight sessions. The recent losses have come despite the Federal Reserve last week saying that all the banks it had examined in a "stress test" met the regulatory minimums for capital. Markets have broadly been pressured by the prospect of trade tensions between the U.S. and its major trading partners, while banks have also traded around recent activity in bond yields. While banks typically outperform in periods of rising interest rates, bond yields have stalled after a rise earlier this year. The company said these resulted in an "aggregate cash payment" to HMNY of $20.5 million. The convertible notes will mature in three years, unless they are converted or redeemed earlier. HMNY also said in the filing that it received a letter from the Nasdaq's listing qualifications department last week stating that the company's bid price has been below the $1 per share required to be listed on the Nasdaq. The company said this letter "has no immediate effect on the listing" of its stock, but that it has until mid-December to get back in compliance with the Nasdaq's rule. If the company completes a reverse stock split, which it has sought shareholder approval for, the reverse split must take place no more than 10 business days before December 18. The stock is down 94% in the past 12 months, to 21 cents a share, while the S&P 500 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, -0.71%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         has gained 4.9%.
title: MoviePass majority owner Helios & Matheson's stock falls after company issues $164 million of convertible debt

He wrote that while there is "significant uncertainty" about how the company's various efforts will play out, the stock's valuation seems to reflect those already. "We retain some of our longer term concerns around the sector and stock, but believe that over the next 12 months, the path of least resistance for AT&T's stock is to trade higher," Flannery wrote. He will be watching for the company's ability to reduce leverage and realize synergies from its Time Warner deal. author: TomiKilgore
content:
Harley-Davidson Inc.'s

                                         A- credit rating was placed on CreditWatch with negative implications Wednesday at S&P Global Ratings, citing increased business risks as a result of tariffs and declining sales and shipments. The A- rating is four notches above speculative grade, or junk, territory. The motorcycle maker said this week that it would not raise prices to combat retaliatory tariffs imposed by the European Union, which could raise the average cost of EU bound motorcycles by $2,200, and plans to eventually shift some production overseas to reduce the impact of the tariffs. "The CreditWatch placement reflects our belief that near-term cost increases due to retaliatory tariffs imposed by the EU, combined with other significant headwinds, could cause margin deterioration and increase business risks over the next several years," S&P said in a statement. "We could lower our rating on Harley as a result." The stock edged up 0.2% in premarket trade Wednesday, after tumbling 8.7% over the previous three sessions. It has lost 19% year to date through Tuesday, while the S&P 500 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, -0.71%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         has gained 1.9%.

author: JeremyC.Owens
content:
The hometown of Alphabet Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    GOOGL, -0.95%
GOOG, -0.92%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         will vote on a new tax in November that would charge large companies a fee per employee, similar to a tax that Seattle recently repealed after a campaign led by companies like Amazon.com Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    AMZN, -0.64%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         and Starbucks Corp. The so-called Google tax would charge companies with more than 50 workers in the city a fee per employee that scales higher the larger the worker base in Mountain View. While the Seattle tax was specifically earmarked for homeless issues, the Mountain View tax would be general funds for the city to use as it sees fit, according to the ordinance approved by the Mountain View City Council on Tuesday evening. The tax would raise about $6 million a year, and more than half would come from Google, which has more than 20,000 employees in the city, according to reports. Alphabet has yet to take an official position on the ballot measure. Alphabet shares were trading about 0.5% higher in premarket trading Wednesday morning, and have gained 7.5% so far this year, while the S&P 500 index

                                         has increased 1.9%.
title: 'Google tax' headed for November ballot in Silicon Valley city

Payroll service revenue grew 3% to $452.4 million, just shy of the FactSet consensus of $453.0 million, while human resources revenue jumped 17% to $401.0 million to top expectations of $397.2 million. U.S. stock-index futures on Wednesday morning, ridden by tariff-driven jitters, turned positive after the Trump administration said it would rely on the interagency Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States, or CFIUS, to address concerns about foreign purchases of sensitive domestic technologies, reports said Wednesday, citing an administration official. Dow Jones Industrial Average futures

                                         advanced by about 0.1% at 7,107. The news on Beijing's investment in U.S. tech assets comes amid elevated tensions between China and the U.S., which have helped to rattle equity benchmarks across the globe. Earlier in the week, reports indicated that Trump wanted to curb investments by China in U.S. technology corporations, which heightened concerns that a full-scale trade war between the two largest economies, which could spill over into global economies, was nearing. However, the recent White House statement suggests that the President rejects more-aggressive restrictions on Chinese investments.
title: U.S.stock futures stage turnaround--turn positive--after White House statement on Chinese tech investments

author: RobertSchroeder
content: The Trump administration will rely on the interagency Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States to address concerns about foreign purchases of sensitive domestic technologies, reports said Wednesday, citing an administration official. President Donald Trump supports a push in Congress to expand CFIUS' authority to address concerns about China buying stakes in U.S. companies in order to acquire technology, the New York Times said. Trump rejected more-aggressive restrictions that would have imposed new curbs on Beijing.
title: Trump backs expanding CFIUS' authority to limit Chinese investments in U.S.

author: CiaraLinnane
content:
Summit Therapeutics plc shares 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SMMT, -0.85%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         plunged 77% in premarket trade Wednesday, after the biotech said a trial of a treatment for the serious disease Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD) failed to meet its main goals. The Phase 2 clinical trial, called PhaseOut DMD, sought to evaluate the company's utrophin modulator, ezutromid, in 40 patients with DMD, but failed to meet its primary endpoint after 48 weeks. "These data come as a great disappointment to us and to all those living with DMD," said Glyn Edwards, Chief Executive Officer of Summit. "While we believe utrophin modulation could still have a place in the treatment of DMD, it is clear that ezutromid is not providing a benefit for patients. We therefore feel that our resources are better focused on the development of our promising pipeline of new mechanism antibiotics." Utrophin is a protein naturally produced by the human body when muscle first forms or when it's repairing. As muscle matures, it is replaced by dystrophin, but for DMD patients, dystrophin does not function properly. The company will stop development of ezutromid and take cost-cutting measures. CR845 that lack abuse potential and traditional mu opioid side effects, we will be assessing all options, including discussions with regulators, as to how to best move this program forward," Cara Chief Executive Derek Chalmers said in a statement. Excluding non-recurring items, adjusted earnings per share came to 79 cents, above the FactSet consensus of 71 cents. Sales increased 2.2% to $3.89 billion, as better-than-expected convenience store and foodservice sales offset a miss in North America retail sales, its largest sales segment. For fiscal 2019, organic net sales are expected to be flat to up 1%, or up 9% to 10% if the impact of the Blue Buffalo acquisition is included. The FactSet consensus $17.28 billion implies 9.8% revenue growth.                                          slid 73% in premarket trade Wednesday, after the Canadian-based biotech said a trial of a treatment for cystitis and severe bladder pain syndrome failed to meet its main goal. "This is a disappointing result for Aquinox and for patients," Chief Executive David Mai said in a statement. The trial, called LEADERSHIP 301, "was a robust and well-conducted trial, and we believe the results are definitive." The company said the results support halting all further development, but it plans to review its pipeline and provide further guidance later this year. The trial involved 433 participants who received Aquinox's once-daily, oral rosiptor, or AQX-1125, or placebo. It failed to achieve a statistically significant reduction in mean change from Baseline at Week 12 in maximum daily bladder pain score inthe female patients, which was its primary endpoint. The company will host a conference call at 8.30 a.m. ET Wednesday. Shares have gained 30% in 2018 through Tuesday, while the S&P 500

author: MarketWatch
content: National security adviser John Bolton is set to meet with Russian President Vladimir Putin at the Kremlin Wednesday, Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov told reporters in Moscow, the Washington Post and other news outlets reported. Bolton, whom the White House previously said would likely see Putin at some point in the runup to the U.S.-Russia summit, is in Moscow ahead of an expected sitdown between Putin and President Trump in mid-July. Bolton is also meeting with Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov, Kremlin foreign policy adviser Yuri Ushakov and members of Russia's Security Council, the reports said. The Trump-Putin summit would be the first meeting of the two presidents not limited to the sidelines of a broader international gathering. Trump is scheduled to attend the summit meeting of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization July 11-12 and to visit Britain on July 13.
title: National security adviser John Bolton meeting Putin ahead of summit with Trump: reports

author: MikeMurphy
content: Rep. Joe Crowley of New York, the fourth-ranking Democrat in the House and once seen as a possible successor to Nancy Pelosi as minority leader, suffered a stunning primary loss to Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez on Tuesday. Ocasio-Cortez, a 28-year-old community activist running on a progressive agenda, was outspent by an 18-1 margin and ran on a platform of Medicare for all and reining in Wall Street. Crowley, 56, was first elected to Congress in 1999 and was a mainstay of the Democratic establishment, while Ocasio-Cortez was endorsed by MoveOn.org and the Democratic Socialists of America. The result may be the biggest primary upset since Virginia Republican Rep. Eric Cantor lost in 2014. New York's 14th Congressional District, which includes parts of the Bronx and Queens, is heavily Democratic, and Ocasio-Cortez becomes the heavy favorite to win the general election in November.
title: Rep. Joe Crowley stunned by progressive challenger in New York primary

The recent losses have come despite the Federal Reserve last week saying that all the banks it had examined in a "stress test" met the regulatory minimums for capital. Markets have broadly been pressured by the prospect of trade tensions between the U.S. and its major trading partners, while banks have also traded around recent activity in bond yields. While banks typically outperform in periods of rising interest rates, bond yields have stalled after a rise earlier this year.
title: Financial ETF drops for 12th straight session, longest streak on record

author: MyraP.Saefong
content:
The American Petroleum Institute reported Tuesday that U.S. crude supplies dropped by 9.2 million barrels for the week ended June 22, according to sources. The API data, however, showed a rise of nearly 1.2 million barrels in gasoline stockpiles, while inventories of distillates rose by 1.8 million barrels, sources said. Supply data from the Energy Information Administration will be released Wednesday morning. Analysts polled by S&P Global Platts expect the EIA to report a fall of 2.3 million barrels in crude supplies. They also forecast supply increases of 160,000 barrels for gasoline, and 500,000 barrels for distillates. author: JeffryBartash
content: The Democratic attorney generals in 17 U.S. states, including New York and California, sued the Trump administration in an effort to force the White House to reunite migrant families separated at the border. The suit contends that a Trump order last week to stop separating families contains too many loopholes and isn't working, according to the Associated Press. Under a so-called "zero tolerance" policy, border agents had been detaining parents and children who entered the U.S. illegally in different locations. The ensuing uproar forced the president to back down.
title: 17 states sue Trump White House on migrant-family separation

The same executive, Rob Leathern, wrote in a blog post Tuesday that Facebook would begin allowing pre-approved advertisers to promote cryptocurrencies and some related content, but would still block ads for binary options and initial coin offerings. "Given these restrictions, not everyone who wants to advertise will be able to do so," Leathern wrote. "But we'll listen to feedback, look at how well this policy works and continue to study this technology so that, if necessary, we can revise it over time." Facebook stock was trading less than 1% higher Tuesday, while cryptocurrency prices were broadly lower.
title: Facebook to allow cryptocurrency ads again

author: AndreaRiquier
content:
The National Fair Housing Alliance, 19 fair housing organizations, and two Maryland homeowners on Tuesday filed a federal Fair Housing Act lawsuit against Bank of America 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    BAC, -1.30%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         and a property management company, alleging that they failed to maintain the homes they owned in communities made up of people of color, while consistently performing such maintenance in white neighborhoods. The groups allege a "glaring pattern of discriminatory conduct" by the bank and the company, Safeguard Properties Management LLC. The housing groups visited more than 1,600 bank-owned homes and found that 45% of the homes in communities of color had 10 or more visible maintenance "deficiencies" like unmowed lawns, unsecured windows, and graffiti, compared to only 11% of the homes in white neighborhoods. That led to vermin, squatters, and garbage infestations for the homeowners who remain. The plaintiffs say they have asked Bank of America to uphold its responsibility to the properties it owns since 2009, with no luck.
title: Fair-housing groups take aim at Bank of America for racial discrimination in foreclosed homes

                                         are up 1.7% in Tuesday trading after UBS analyst Timothy Arcuri upgraded the stock to neutral from sell. "Major producers are taking a more anticipatory approach to DRAM [dynamic random-access memory] bit supply - averting the downside case that we laid out when launching Micron" with a sell rating in April, Arcuri wrote. "While we maintain fairly draconian views on NAND pricing and 2H recovery seems unlikely, these dynamics force us to reconsider the downside case for MU especially considering our long-term bullish demand view." He thinks that Micron could face some gross-margin pressure next year, as the company's cost-reduction efforts slow, but Arcuri predicts that the company's "more proactive approach to capacity" can limit how much the company's margins may fall. Arcuri raised his price target to $60 from $42. Micron shares are up 66% over the past 12 months, while the PHLX Semiconductor Index 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SOX, -2.47%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         has gained 24% and the S&P 500 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SPX, -0.71%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         has risen 12%.
title: Micron stock gains after UBS upgrade

Shares have sold off in the past month amid concerns that Samsung is delaying memory production, and analysts' estimates have come down as well. Arcuri thinks that the stock has "felt the disproportionate brunt" of these delays, which "sets a low bar" for the company going forward. He predicts that Lam could face the biggest impact from the Samsung delays in the September quarter, while the company's positioning seems poised to improve next calendar year. "Even as we expect less favorable memory pricing in [calendar] 2019, we see a big cushion for memory [wafer fab equipment] and it seems flat or up at all major players in '19," Arcuri wrote. author: EmilyBary
content:
Shares of Sirius XM Holdings Inc. 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    SIRI, -0.50%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         and holding company Liberty Media Corp. SiriusXM 

                            
                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                  
                                    LSXMA, -0.47%

                            
                                  
      
      
      
      
      
      
      
                                         are down 2.1% and 1.7%, respectively, following downgrades at Barclays. Analyst Kannan Venkateshwar lowered his rating on Sirius XM to underweight from equal weight, and he reduced his rating on the Liberty tracking stock to equal weight from overweight. "While execution remains exceptional, in our view, we believe the company is now in a much more mature phase of its growth cycle and the story is changing," Venkateshwar wrote. "Meanwhile, the room to buy back more stock is likely to become constrained, M&A may become a bigger priority, margin expansion may become tougher, and competitive pressures are likely to step up." As for the tracking stock, Venkateshwar said that he still prefers LSXMA over the regular Sirius shares, but he said the NAV discount might close due to Sirius's stock falling, not due to the tracking stock rising. "It is not surprising that Liberty has been looking at other uses of cash such as iHeart instead of buying more LSXMA stock," he said. Sirius shares are up 31% over the past 12 months, while the tracking stock has gained 11%.
title: Sirius XM, Liberty Sirius stocks fall after Barclays downgrades

He was also intrigued that a PayPal executive mentioned that a "disproportionate" amount of stored value in PayPal accounts goes toward buying Amazon.com Inc.
